result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie Edward Harvey Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Willie Edward Harvey Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Willie Edward Harvey Jr was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs to be deducted from 25% of prison wages or by 11.4.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges to be deducted from 25% of prison wages or by 11.4.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

12-21-15/ Judge Frederick C Rosa
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended to state that the defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT with any other sentence.  **9/21/2015 credit amended to 19 days.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

from DOC requesting review of JOC.

Defendant Willie Edward Harvey in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Defendant Willie Edward Harvey in custody.  Amy MacArdy Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Statements made as to sentencing.  

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS CONCURRENT to any other sentence, with credit for 146 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs to be deducted from 25% of prison wages or by 11.4.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges to be deducted from 25% of prison wages or by 11.4.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

As to Count 1 amended: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant he will need to provide a DNA sample  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

State moved to withdraw the exhibits that were received during the trial. Exhibits withdrawn.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 07.  All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.

Defendant Willie Edward Harvey in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Defendant Willie Edward Harvey in custody.  Denis John Stingl and Amy McCarty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case was in the middle of a jury trial, however; the parties have reached a resolution. Defense wishes to proceed with a plea. Negotiations placed on the record. 

Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered Count 1 amended to Second Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.30(2) and 939.50(3)(g), a Class G Felony.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 2 on the original Information dismissed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willie Edward Harvey in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Defendant Willie Edward Harvey in custody.  Denis John Stingl  and Attorney McCarty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jury in box at the hour of 11:30am. Court instructed the jury. Jury out of box at 11:32am. Court ordered case adjourned until 07/15/2015 at 1:00pm for continuation of jury trial in Branch 07.

Sworn for the state:  Jacqueline Dennis, Lajuanda Anderson, MPD Officer George Simonson. Exhibits 26-28  received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for defense: *.  Defense rests.  Sworn for state as rebuttal witness: *.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of * to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies * who were duly sworn for that purpose.  At the hour of * the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of * which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

Defendant Willie Edward Harvey in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Defendant Willie Edward Harvey in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Some jurors may have seen the defendant in passing this morning. The defendant would like to proceed and waives his right to have a new panel selected. 
Opening statements by state and defense.  Sworn for the state:  MPD Officer Gary Cherone. Exhibits  1-9, 20-24 received.  Jury trial scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court will listen to 911 tapes and will not give an early ruling.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:46 pm.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.

Defendant Willie Edward Harvey in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Defendant Willie Edward Harvey in custody.  Amy Macardy and Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case passed until 1:30 pm.
State's Witness List.

  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 7.  Jury trial scheduled for 07-13-2015 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Joseph Richard Reback in court, defendant Willie Edward Harvey not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case still in trial posture.
State's Witness List and Requested Jury Instructions.

and for jury trial on 7.6.15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 06-22-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph Richard Reback in court, defendant Willie Edward Harvey not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND on behalf of the defendant.    Case adjourned for final pretrial on 5.28.15 and for jury trial on 6.8.15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 05-28-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Willie Edward Harvey in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Defendant Willie Edward Harvey in custody.  Ron Dague for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Gary Cherone-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JACQUELINE D. AND ANGLE S. OR HER RESIDENCE OR ANY PLACE WHERE SHE IS KNOWN TO BE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Willie Edward Harvey in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MCADAMS, Branch 7.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
